comments.text:
+Sir Wafflehat +One Bound If I may interject, I am aware of the Burden of 
Proof argument, which lies on the one making a positive claim. Saying "God 
does not exist" is not a positive claim, so it's impossible to disprove a 
negative. This is matching to the arguments you both mentioned, that we 
cannot disprove the existence of a god.
However, two things I'd like to mention here for any future readers to 
reflect to. For one, we may not disprove a god, any less than we can 
disprove other mythical creatures, but if a god exists, then we should be 
able to prove his existence somehow. Make him appear in person, make him 
answer prayers, and so on. Sure, we'd still have our reasons to be 
skeptical if that really is the god everyone's talking about, but at least 
we'd have some insight on the existence of supernatural deities. 
Unfortunately, however, lack of evidence pointing in that direction is only 
leaving us with burdening the believers with the need to provide evidence, 
and the fact that there's no disproving a negative.
And secondly, and this is my personal hypothesys, we may not be able to 
disprove the existence of some kind of supernatural deity, as we cannot say 
for certain that there is no such thing as universal intelligent, sentient, 
omnipotent force governing our cosmos. However, what we can disprove is the 
existence of one god in particular. For example, how do we know Zeus does 
not exist? Because he is said to reside atop of Mt. Olympus along with the 
remaining members of Olympus Twelve in a grand temple makig lightning 
bolts. Once humans actually reached the peak of the mountain, this story 
was just washed away, because we didn't find any evidence that there ever 
was any kind of civilization or celestial presence: there were no celestial 
portals, no places, no gods, and certainly no giant bearded man in a toga 
grabbing and throwing lightning bolts. So how do we apply this to the 
existence of the God of the Bible, which I'm assuming is what we're talking 
about? It's quite obvious, actually, while the image of a Christian God may 
vary depending on society, people, and denominations, the only 
quote-unqoute "proof" of God's existence is said to be the Bible itself. It 
is said to be the divine word of God, unfalsifiable and absolutely true in 
every aspect. So, if we can disrpove what the Bible says, we can likewise 
dismiss the existence of the god depicted in it. And we find just that, 
various biblical claims that do not correspond with physical evidence: 
There are no archeological remains of Noah's ark, the Tower of Babil, the 
Garden of Eden or the Mines of Solomon, and there are no mentions of such 
structures anywhere outside of the Bible. There's also no geological 
evidence of a global flood ever having taken place, and various simulations 
and models have proven that a flood depicted in the Bible could not have 
taken place at any time in Earth's history. There are no records of 
Egyptians opressing Jews into slavery. There are no records that a man 
named Jesus Christ of Nazareth ever existed, and plenty of his so called 
miracles have been attributed to various other mythological figures from 
pagan religions. Disease is caused by germs and pathogens, and not by 
demons. The Earth is not flat, and it is not stationary with the Sun and 
the universe spinning around it. It is also not surrounded by firmaments of 
water, and it is not supported by pillars. A believer drinking poison will 
die at the same rate as a non-believer drinking the same amount of the same 
poison. There's no evidence of Adam and Eve ever existing, and all evidence 
points out to common ancestry instead of spontaneous creation. And this is 
not even taking fantastic events such as people turning into salt, seas 
being divided, dead people rising as well as the existence of dragons, 
unicorns and behemoths, which are completely contradictory to what we can 
observe in the natural world, or the many different contradictions within 
the Bible itself. Without a doubt, the Bible has been wrong with so many 
things in so many different aspects, so even if there is a God, it is 
certainly not the same one that wrote or has been monitoring the writing of 
the Christian Bible.
Besides, the very concept of the Christian god is ridiculous, and illogical 
to say the very least. Perhaps there is a god that is omnipotent, perhaps 
there is a god that is omniscient, perhaps there is a god that is 
omnibenevolent, perhaps there is a god that is all-present, but if you're 
going to claim that your god is all those things at the same time, you're 
going to have problems defending your beliefs. Epicurus made a perfectly 
valid statement on this matter before Christianity even became a thing, and 
I'm not going to quote him on this for the sake of giving some more 
arguments to it. The point is, that all these ideal attributes cancel each 
other out, and if a god exists, he's not at least one of those things. He 
can't be omnipotent if he couldn't stop the various natural disasters that 
threatened the lives of people that prayed to his name. Or maybe he could, 
just didn't know when it was comming. Or maybe he did, but he just didn't 
give two spits about people praying because it would iterveine with his 
great plan. Or perhaps he could do that before, but now he's gone, which 
means he's not eternal. If a god really was allmighty, allknowing, 
transcendend, timeless, perfectly good, eternal and present everywhere, the 
world would be a much different place. And because of what the world today 
looks like, it's safe to say that no such creature exists.

comments.text:
As far as I know, the very first life form to ever exist is a single-called 
organism called Cyanobacteria, which still exist today. They used 
photosynthesis, which created a plethora of oxygen. The abundance of oxygen 
helped the Cyanobacteria evolve into more complex organisms, but life was 
confined in the oceans. The origin of life was hypothesized by am 
experiment called the Electric Spark Experiment, which basically uses 
materials that ancient Earth would've had to simulate how common atoms and 
molecules evolved into living things.

comments.text:
+Majestic Burger Wrapper  God, Jesus, Love, Holy Spirit, Inner Peace all 
the same thing.

No-one has it in this world as our ego is always seeking for it outside 
ourselves were it dwells not.

Eternal Peace is our natural Creation right is it the natural state of the 
Son, in the only Home fit for Him, Heaven.

 "The ego is nothing more than a part of your
belief about yourself. Your other life has continued without interruption, 
ans has been and always will be totally unaffected by your attempts to 
dissociate it.

In learning to escape from illusions, your debt to your brother is 
something you must never forget. It is the same debt that you owe to Me. 
Whenever you act egotistically towards another, you are throwing away the 
graciousness of your indebtedness and the
Holly Perception it would produce.

 The term "Holy" can be used here because
as you learn how much you are indebted to the whole sonship, which includes 
Me, you come as close to Knowledge as perception can. The gap is then so 
small that Knowledge can flow across it to obliterate it forever.

You have very little trust in Me as yet, but it will increase as you turn 
more and more often to Me instead of the ego for guidance. The
results will convince you increasingly that this choice is the only sane 
one you can make.

No one who learns form experience that one
choice brings Peace and Joy while another brings chaos and disaster needs 
additional convincing. Learning through rewards is more effective than 
learning through pain, because pain is an ego illusion, and can never 
induce more than a temporary effect.

The rewards of God however are immediately recognised as Eternal. Since 
this recognition is made by you and not the ego, the recognition itself 
establishes that you and your ego cannot be identical.

You may believe that you have already accepted the difference, but you are 
by no means convinced as yet. The fact that you believe you must escape 
from the ego shows this, but you cannot escape from the ego by humbling it 
or controlling it or punishing
it.

The ego and the Spirit do not know each other. The separated mind cannot 
maintain the separation except by dissociating. Having does this, it denies 
all truly natural impulses, not because the ego is a separate thing, but 
because you want to believe that YOU are.

The ego is a device for maintaining this belief, but it is still only your 
decision to use the device that enables it to endure.

How can you teach someone the value of something he has deliberately thrown 
away?

He must have thrown it away because he did not value it.

You can only show him how miserable he is without it, and slowly bring it 
nearer so he can learn how his misery lessens as he approaches it.

 This teaches him to associate his misery with its absence, and the 
opposite of misery with its presence. It gradually becomes desirable as he 
changes his mind about its worth.

 I am teaching you to associate  misery with the ego and Joy with the 
Spirit. You have taught yourself the opposite.

You are still free to choose, but can you really want the rewards of the 
ego in the presence of the rewards of God?

My Trust in You is greater than yours in Me at the moment, but it will not 
always be that way.

Your mission is simple. You are asked to live so as to demonstrate that you 
are not an ego, and I do not choose God's channels wrongly.

The Holy One shares My Trust and accepts My Atonement decisions because My 
decisions are never out of accord with His.

I have said before that I am in charge of the Atonement. This is only 
because I completed My part in it as a man, and now complete it
through others.

My chosen channels cannot fail, because I will lend them My Strength as 
long as theirs is wanting." "ACIM"

Providing further evidence of Osiris's pre-Christian role as a dying and 
rising savior god, several early Church fathers, including Athanasius, 
Augustine, Theophilus, Athenagoras, Minucius Felix, Lactantius and 
Firmicus, discussed the Egyptian god's death as mourned "every good Friday."

Osiris surrounded by Twelve Stars and Circles (Hornung, 'The Valley of the 
Kings,' 94)The death and resurrection of the sun god have astrotheological 
meaning, signifying the waxing and waning of the moon, which reflects the 
sun's light, as well as the daily rising and setting of the sun and the 
annual shortening and lengthening of the day. As part of his 
astrotheological journey, Osiris "traverses the twelve sections of the 
Duat," and, as the sun god, Osiris has twelve companions—the Signs of the 
Zodiac." Thus, in the myth of Osiris is the great teaching god with the 
twelve disciples who dies and resurrects, millennia before the Christian 
era. The evidence abundantly points to Jesus Christ as a nearly identical, 
mythical remake of the highly popular Osiris, whose story was known by 
millions of pilgrims for thousands of years in precisely the same areas in 
which the Christian myth arose.



a son who is a powerful entity himself who is killed or dies for his people 
and comes back to life for the good of his people and an afterlife similar 
to an earthly existence is repeated in religious texts from Phoenicia (2700 
BCE) to Sumer (2100 BCE) to Palestine (1440 BCE) to Greece (800 BCE) and 
finally to Rome (c. 100 CE). The Phoenician tale of the great god Baal who 
dies and returns to life to battle the chaos of the god Yamm was already 
old in 2750 BCE when the city of Tyre was founded (according to Herodotus) 
and the Greek story of the dying and reviving god Adonis (c. 600 BCE) was 
derived from earlier Phoenician tales based on Tammuz which was borrowed by 
the Sumerians (and later the Persians) in the famous Descent of Innana myth.




This theme of life-after-death and life coming from death and, of course, 
the judgement after death, gained greatest fame through the evangelical 
efforts of St. Paul who spread the word of the dying and reviving god Jesus 
Christ throughout ancient Palestine, Asia Minor, Greece and Rome (c. 42-62 
CE).

comments.text:
If you're wondering where animals came from, that's fairly simple. The 
first forms of life were strands (or chains) of ribonucleic acid (or RNA); 
RNA evolved due to the composition of earth's water about 2-3 billion years 
ago, being filled with nucleotides, which are a nitrogenous base with a 
supporting structure of a sugar phosphate. RNA is composed of these 
nucleotides, and natural selection would play out in competition between 
different chains of RNA for nucleotides (as what could be equated to as a 
source of food). The composition of RNA would state that a chain of these 
nucleotides (arranged to carry all genetic information) would break down 
over time; and hence RNA chains would evolve to attract more nucleotides to 
replace the ones that were breaking down (hence the equation to being a 
source of food). One such evolution to attract more of these nucleotides, 
would be for RNA chains to cooperate, forming the first so-called 
"protocells." And furthermore, certain chains developed an attraction to 
amino acid binding (called "peptide-bonding"). Said amino acids assisted in 
RNA syntheses, giving them the selective advantage over other chains, hence 
a better chance of survival from these adaptations. 
While it is still uncertain how it happened, RNA at some point transitioned 
to being a deoxyribonucleic acid (or DNA) system of genetic coding. DNA was 
still an independent organism at this point, but was a far more efficient 
genetic coder, due to a different base structure and complexity of the 
double helix (in comparison to what would equate to a single helix of an 
RNA chain). Like RNA, DNA would compete for base molecules in its structure 
to keep a chain alive; and similar adaptations that were made in RNA, were 
made in DNA. One such would be cooperation of multiple DNA chains, until 
enough had been made to construct an entire prokaryotic cell structure 
(which itself could asexually reproduce as well). Prokaryotic structures 
required no cellular nucleus, and hence had no specific organization of 
organelles, and hence were a simple enough structure to be made by 
primitive DNA bonding. This adaption would eventually lead to multicellular 
structures, and/or other species of cells.
The first evolution to cells in making them more complex and successful, 
was the cell nucleus, which could organize the organelles of a cell to do 
specific vital tasks for life. Such eukaryotes as they would be named, were 
often more successful than their prokaryotic counterparts; much like DNA 
being successful compared to its simpler, RNA counterpart. The complexity 
and organization of the eukaryotic cells allowed for more complex roles as 
individuals (i.e. developing photosynthesis or hunting other cells for food 
(immersion of plants/ animals)), and for complex inter-cellular 
relationships and cooperation. Eukaryotic cells, whether photosynthetic, or 
carnivorous, could bond together into multicellular structures; much like 
DNA into the first actual cells. However, they were still limited in many 
ways that DNA cooperative groups didn't have to face, such as: Remaining 
two cells thick in all regions, given that all cells had to be exposed to 
water, a third cell in between two would dehydrate completely. Also, cells 
could still live as individuals rather than groups, and hence they weren't 
truly multicellular organisms, but rather globs of potentially individual 
cells. 
The first actual multicellular organisms appeared when cells could evolve 
to fit specific roles in a complex body (such as skin, brain, stomach, 
muscle etc). These organisms could grow as their cells multiplied; however 
a severe issue arose: Bodies this complex could no longer asexually 
reproduce; and hence for a very long period of time, could only grow 
individually. The problem of asexual reproduction was solved by male and 
female counterparts, given traits of male or female sexual organs (such as 
a simpler format of a penis or vagina in an animal). Along with organs that 
could facilitate sexual reproduction/intercourse, there were gender 
specific cells that could carry the DNA of the host animal; given eggs for 
females, and a fertilizer cell for males (such as sperm). 
Sexual reproduction allowed for massive changes in a species; as now there 
were animals (and plants) with varied genomes, interbreeding and 
normalizing into groups. Even though a species could undergo massive change 
via sexual reproduction, they tended to not differ greatly from one another 
(one another of the same specie that is). And given the conditions under 
which sexual reproduction had to occur (from varied groups of cooperating 
eukaryotic cells that had now been assigned specific jobs to a body 
function), a normalized specie, and greater differences between species 
than between individuals was a drastic change. Changes in a specie now 
didn't only result in physical differences, but also, species would now 
have certain behavioral traits; resulting in more terms of natural 
selection, hence more evolution of species until today.

comments.text:
+Jesus is for real 777 Not air (many microorganisms don't need it, and 
early molecular organisms and early organisms analogous to algae didn't... 
Those things, along with plants later on, were what made the air we have 
now...), and water isn't NECESSARILY needed depending on the other 
chemistry (probably for carbon-based life, but we are not really even sure 
of that), but you do need *some* kind of chemically stable liquid for life 
that is anything like what we see on this planet to form, that is, any life 
that is made of some kind of self-replicating protein analogue that forms 
cells.

The only kind of life we know about evolved using liquid water though, we 
know for sure that water works for life, and it is one thing all life on 
this planet has in common... Water is also very abundant in the universe, 
and we know the areas around stars where liquid water can most likely be 
found so those are the best places to look at least as a starting point.  

But yeah, as vast as the universe is, it's very likely that there are all 
kinds of weird things out there, silicon-based life, life that evolved in a 
gas environment, maybe even in stars... It may even have formed on a planet 
in a way much like we did, but then evolved to live in space using totally 
different energy sources and means of replication... though we'd have a 
hard time figuring out how to look for such things or recognize them even 
if we found them.  Also, traveling to any place that might have liquid 
water, besides maybe Mars, is pretty much science fiction right now.

our solar system we know that might have liquid water (and forget about 
living on those... Europa and Titan are not friendly places, nor are 
comets)...

comments.text:
+Dylan Olson It is important to note that the scientists who are backing 
global warming are in loop with each other. They are interested in 
financial gain, not saving the environment. Take Al Gore for example. He's 
not interested in "saving the environment." Just look at the way he lives. 
He is purely in it for the financial prophet. If global warming is real, 
how come you don't see politicians taking a bigger initiative to combat it? 
How come they themselves do not bother to live the green lifestyles which 
they preach of? It is in fact because their cause is utterly, undeniably 
untrue. The vast majority of scientists not publicized by the liberal media 
not only detest global warming, but also bring sufficient scientific 
evidence to the table which disproves global warming entirely. The 
phenomena labeled "global warming" in recent times has been updated to 
"climate change" for good reason. Our Earth is constantly changing and has 
been doing so far beyond the introduction of humans into this world. It 
will continue to do so up until its demise. Ive done many hours worth of 
research on both sides of this most confusing equation from a variety of 
resources and have come to the reasonable conclusion that the Earth in fact 
is not getting warmer in the slightest. Diverging slightly from the topic, 
I will go on. Humans need to change the world. If our early human 
forefathers did not attempt to advance and live with the smallest impact 
possible, the evolution and progress of humankind would not be as rapid as 
it was. Progress would be very slow indeed. Humans must change the world 
for the good of their own existence. It is not out of convenience that we 
have millions of supermarkets, but out of necessity. With millions of 
mouths to feed, the entire human population could simply not be sustained 
off of small markets. It is not out of selfishness that we guzzle fuel, it 
is out of a need to ship and move goods for an exponentially growing 
population. The claim that sea levels will rise due to global warming is 
false for two reasons. One is that global reason, as shown by various 
sources, is a false cause. Two is supported by physics itself. You at home 
right now. Go ahead and take a glass and pour a good amount of water in it. 
Now a couple ice cubes. Mark where the level of the water is including ice 
cubes. Now just let it melt. You will see that the amount of water in the 
glass is unchanged even though the ice has melted. This is for two main 
reasons. One is that ice is in fact mostly composed of air, not water. This 
is why ice floats. Once melted the air would simply escape. Two, the water 
melted from the ice cube would fill the area in the glass the ice cube 
displaced prior to it melting. This means that the amount of water the ice 
cube contains would be equal to the area it displaced. If we compare this 
small scale experiment on a larger scale, we would see that the water in 
the glass would behave as the ocean does and the ice put in the glass would 
behave as glaciers do. We can deduce that the only way to cause a positive 
change in the water level of the Earth would be to add more water to Earth 
from an outside source. This disproves the theory of rising sea levels. 
Also, the "sea" in "sea levels" refers to a sea, which is an enclosed body 
of water such as the Dead Sea or the Salton Sea. Global warming has been 
proved untrue. There are only a small number of sources of the studies 
which suggest global warming is true. There are however a large number of 
sources of the studies which suggest and prove global warming to be false. 
I have done my homework, and I suggest you do your. You will be happily 
surprised. One last thing, they say ignorance is bliss. Don't let yourself 
become the living example of that. Have a good one mate. :)

captions.text:
• From lakes that actually explode to a
twin planet that crashed into Earth once upon

a time, we count 15 facts about the little
blue planet we like to call home

15 - 24 Hours,
• The common saying goes that there's only

24 hours in a day - but that isn't actually
true, the Earth spins on its axis for 23 hours

and 56 minutes
• The reason we add an extra 4 minutes is

because the distance in which we've orbited
the sun is so great that it takes some extra

time just for us to face the sun again
• And since the Earth is spinning slower

and slower every few million years, in around
250 million years a typical day will actually

last 1.5 hours longer
14 - Gravity Glitch,

• There is an area in Canada known as Hudson
Bay with uneven mass - and where there's uneven

mass, there's uneven gravity
• Long-since melted glaciers once lined

the area, but now they're gone and the burden
of gravity remains in both the ice sheets

and underneath the Earth's crust, leading
to lower gravity here than anywhere else on

Earth
• Don't get too excited though - it's not

like you'll be able to start moon-jumping
around Canada - the difference in gravity

is only a 0.005% reduction, so minute that
you can't even feel it

13 - Photo,
• 65 miles above the atmosphere, the first

ever photo of Earth was taken with a camera
carried by a V-2 missile in 1946 - it snapped

a frame every second and a half and managed
to survive re-entry

• The scientists who reviewed the footage
were beyond ecstatic, jumping up and down

with joy that they could finally see their
own world in a still image

• Likewise in 1967 the first full-on, colour
Earth image was taken by the DODGE satellite,

which you can see on-screen here
12 - Ocean Salt,

• Most of the salt in our ocean comes from
rocks on the shores, mainly because rainwater

which is naturally acidic breaks down the
rock and distributes their components into

the water
• Seawater salt is so dense that if you

were to dissolve all the oceans in the world
and spread the remaining salt over all the

land on earth, you'd have a 500 foot thick
salt layer coating EVERYTHING

11 - Rocks Can Walk,
• There exists a flat lakebed in Death Valley

known as Racetrack Playa, in which rocks physically
move from place to place

• And it's not just small rocks, but ones
weighing tens or hundreds of pounds - the

theory goes that these ice-encrusted rocks
are flooded by meltwater from the hills

• This makes everything nice and slick which,
along with a hard breeze, allows the rock

to travel
10 - Twin Planet,

• There is a well known theory that at the
beginning of Earth's development there existed

a smaller twin planet known as Theia, roughly
the size of mars

• 4.5 billion years ago it crashed into
Earth and while most of it was absorbed into

Earth's crust, the rest drifted off and formed
that celestial body known as the Moon

• The reason this theory came about is because
typically planets of Earth's size don't have

moons quite so big, and not to mention various
matters found on the Moon are somehow shared

with Earth
9 - Heat,

• Many assume the Sun to be our main source
of energy, a life-giving ball of energy to

which we are utterly dependent - and that
if we ever stopped receiving heat from the

sun, the human race would go extinct
• In reality, Earth's core is just as hot

as the surface of the Sun - between 5,000
to 7,000 degrees celcius

• In the event of a catastrophe say, sun
rays are permanently blocked by clouds and

all land on Earth freezes, we can still harness
the energy within Earth to keep us alive

8 - Exploding Lakes,
• Three lakes in Cameroon, near the border

of the Congo named Nyos, Monoun and Kivu - more
commonly referred to as the exploding lakes

• In 1984 on a small stretch of road, a
gas cloud appeared and swallowed a great many

local villagers walking on their way to work
before getting swept away with the wind

• 37 people were killed instantly, and they
discovered the gas cloud was in fact carbon

dioxide released in an explosion from the
lakes, which happened to be sitting above

volcanic Earth - and continue to do so to
this day

7 - Unexplored Oceans,
• Even though we've touched down on the

Moon and conquered vast mountains, the truth
is we've only explored little under 10% of

the ocean
• To this day we've only discovered near

210,000 underwater species with an estimated
20 million yet to be seen

• That means a distant fish-human hybrid
may indeed have evolved somewhere deep beneath

the ocean surface, and mermaids could still
be a real thing - either that, or more species

of fungus
6 - Supercontinent,

• Back a long time ago when dinosaurs first
roamed the Earth, there existed a supercontinent

called Pangaea that merged all the countries
of the world together into one landmass

• But did you know that another supercontinent
will form in the next 250 million years?

• It's name will be Pangaea Ultima, including
a subduction of the western Atlantic, the

destruction of the Atlantic and Indian basin,
rejoining America with Africa and Europe - the

centre of this giant landmass effectively
a semi-arad desert prone to extreme temperatures

5 - Leaving a Mark,
• Nuclear tests in the 1950s continuing

to this day have thrown dust into the atmosphere
circling our planet - most of it falls down

as rain and snow, but some gets trapped in
glaciers

• These glaciers formed over millions of
years leave timeline indicators that help

scientists date the exact time that piece
of ice formed in Earth's history

• Which means when scientists of the future
look at our glacier slice, they'll no doubt

shake their heads and whisper a gentle "goddamnit"
• That's IF the glaciers survive their rapid

melting from global warming - which they aren't
4 - Earth Isn't Round,

• For a long time in Earth's history, people
have believed the world is flat and no doubt

you'll find people tell you this even in the
comment section of this video

• But the Earth isn't exactly round either
- there's a bulge inside the equator stretching

about 20 miles outwards, which actually gives
it more of a rotund appearance if you look

at it from the right angle
• So while it is technically circle, like

all bodies that have eaten take away one too
many times, the slight gut gives it away

3 - Underwater Gold,
• If you were to go exploring in the deep,

vast oceans, you might discover some flakes
of gold, but did you know there are more than

20 million tons of gold at the bottom of the
sea?

• The only reason we haven't grabbed our
scuba gear and excavation equipment is because

the gold is spread out over such a wide area,
where one litre of water contains just 13

billionths of a gram of gold that people don't
think it's worth it

• There currently doesn't exist any efficient
way of harvesting this gold - but if we could

manage it, we'd have enough to give every
single person on earth 9 pounds worth of gold

2 - Largest Living Thing,
• Most would point to the Blue Whale if

asked to identify the largest living creature
on this planet, but there exists another living

organism that could easily top it
• One mushroom grows fungus which tunnels

underground, one particular variety of honey
mushroom found in Oregon was discovered to

be over 2,200 acres big, stretching all underground
• Try to imagine yourself with body hair

spanning over 2,000 football fields and you're
able to feel everything that comes into contact

with it - and you'll know what it's like to
be this mushroom

1 - Super-Earths
• Earth has always been a curious place

because it's only just barely far enough away
from the sun not to get burnt, but not so

far that it freezes
• Scientists have been searching through

a number of exoplanets, planets that orbit
another star other than our sun that happen

to be in the habitable zone, not too hot and
not too cold - just enough of both to sustain

life as we know it
• Since 2012, several Super-Earths have

been discovered considerably bigger than Earth
but still in the habitable zone - we've even

seen a planet discovered this year that is
roughly the same size, could theoretically

sustain life and orbits a red dwarf
• There's no telling if we'll ever find

another Earth - that's a job left to the future
generations

title: 15 Things You Didn't Know About Earth
